meanings.definition: Injured or discolored by a blow
meanings.sent1: The bruised apple had a dark spot where it was hit.
meanings.sent2: She had a bruised knee from falling off her bike.
meanings.sent3: The bruised banana looked like it had a tiny black eye.
meanings.sent4: His bruised ego made him hesitant to try again.
meanings.sent5: The bruised peach was too soft to eat.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of wear or damage
meanings.sent1: The old book had bruised corners from being carried everywhere.
meanings.sent2: Her bruised shoes indicated they were well-loved and worn often.
meanings.sent3: The bruised teddy bear had patches sewn on its worn-out fur.
meanings.sent4: The bruised car had seen better days, with scratches and dents all over.
meanings.sent5: The bruised table had marks from years of use.

meanings.definition: To crush or grind into a powder or paste
meanings.sent1: She bruised the garlic to add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent2: The chef bruised the herbs to release their aroma.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally bruised the spices, creating a cloud of powder in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The mortar and pestle were used to bruise the ingredients into a fine paste.
meanings.sent5: The recipe called for bruising the nuts to sprinkle on top.
